question: A 5 yr old boy started having tea-colored urine and periorbital edema. He has moderate hypertension, and urine microscopy shows red blood cell casts. Serum creatinine is increased. He had crusted yellow lesions around his mouth and nose a month ago that resolved with topical antibiotics. What is a renal biopsy likely to show?

choices.b: Glomerular capillary loops with linear IgG immunofluorescence
choices.c: Diffuse glomerular capillary wall thickening with spikes on silver stain
choices.d: Diffusely and globally enlarged, hypercellular glomeruli with leukocytic infiltrates

question: Chronic hepatitis B is defined by persistent positivity of which of the following serum markers?

Increased risk for gallbladder carcinoma, EXCEPT

choices.d: 30 y/o/M with chronic biliary infection with Opisthorchis spp

question: Which of the following histologic findings in chronic cholecystitis are formed in response to increased intraluminal pressure of the gallbladder?

A 70 yr old male with a history of lower urinary tract symptoms is found to have enlarged prostate with a proliferation of benign glandular and stromal elements. Which of the following statements is TRUE of this lesion?

choices.b: Gross areas of necrosis are often seen
choices.d: Increased risk of renal tract infection

question: A 60 year old woman who has a history of repetitive blood transfusion and developed bronze discoloration. Lab result; elevated serum ferritin and elevated FBS. ECG: atrial fibrillation. Which of the following below is she most likely to have?

An obese 25-year-old female presents with infertility problems. She has a history of oligomenorrhea. PE reveals hirsutism on the face. Ultrasound reveals an enlarged right ovary. What would be the expected laboratory results?

choices.a: Serum FSH - increased; Serum LH - increased; Serum Testosterone - increased; TSH - normal
choices.b: Serum FSH - decreased; Serum LH - decreased; Serum Testosterone decreased; TSH - decreased
choices.c: Serum FSH - increased; Serum LH - decreased;
choices.d: Serum FSH - decreased; Serum LH - increased; Serum Testosterone - normal; TSH - increased

PE reveals a left adnexal mass with tenderness on palpation. She is afebrile. The beta-human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) is elevated. What is the most probable diagnosis?

choices.b: 60 year old female, asymptomatic, with enlarged sublingual mass

question: Which of the following is a feature shared by BOTH branchial cyst and thyroglossal duct cyst?

choices.a: Cyst content may be clear and mucinous or viscous fluid
choices.b: Found in upper lateral aspect of the neck
choices.d: Presence of lymphoid follicles with germinal centers

question: A 56-year-old female complained of a slowly growing painful preauricular mass of 3cm. On microscopy, sheets of epithelial and myoepithelial cells dispersed in a bluish cartilaginous stroma were seen. Which of the following is TRUE regarding this condition?

choices.a: It is the most common malignant salivary gland neoplasm
choices.b: Relatively rare in minor salivary glands
choices.c: If epithelial cells predominate, there is a higher risk for malignancy.
choices.d: If mesenchymal cells predominate, there is a higher risk for malignancy.

question: A 60 yr old female actress complains of a 2.0 cm, slow-growing, left buccal mucosa mass. She also complains of dull, constant pain. Excision was done and microscopy revealed tubular and cribriform structures with microcysts lined by small cells with dark, compact nuclei. TRUE of this neoplasm:

choices.a: Lymphovascular invasion can account for the pain symptoms
choices.b: It is the most common malignant salivary gland neoplasm
choices.c: Commonly metastasizes to the lymph node
choices.d: It is a slow-growing salivary gland tumor

question: A 19 yr old male develops painful vesicles near his mouth, along with low-grade fever and palpable submandibular lymph nodes. choices.a: Poor osteoclast function due to a mutation in carbonic anhydrase 2 (CA2)
choices.d: Imbalance in osteoblast and osteoclast activity with an osteoclastic activity, mixed with osteoblastic/osteoclastic activity, followed by an osteoblastic activity

choices.b: Normal serum alkaline phosphatase; Elevated calcium levels

question: Which of the following complications is the patient most likely to experience because of this condition?

Lab studies show that he does not have serum antibodies to acetylcholine receptors. He was prescribed acetylcholinesterase agents but shows no improvement. choices.a: Low back pain and absence of HLA-B2 are characteristic of ankylosing spondylitis
choices.b: Reactive arthritis is characterized by arthritis, conjunctivitis, and psoriasis
choices.c: Rheumatoid factor and nodules are generally absent in juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
choices.d: Synovium becomes thickened and forms villous fronds in osteoarthritis

On PE, the involved joints are swollen and warm to the touch. The right second and third digits have a deformity, and there is ulnar deviation of both hands. choices.b: Synovial cell hyperplasia with dense inflammatory infiltrates

question: A 25 yr old female complains of general weakness. Diplopia and a palpable neck mass was seen on P.E. Nerve conduction is normal but there is a decrease in motor response after repeated stimulation. What is the cause of weakness?
Which statement is associated with Guillain-Barre?

choices.a: Infections often coexist with the neuropathy
choices.c: There is greater initial upper extremity deficits

question: A 38 yr old woman has had episodes of numbness and tingling in both hands for 5 months. The problem typically occurs near the end of the day and makes it difficult for her to use the computer keyboard. The thumb and first two fingers are most affected. There is no pain or swelling, and she does not recall any trauma to the upper extremities. On physical examination, thenar muscle atrophy seems to be present. Which of the following conditions is most likely causing her problem?

A 48 yr old woman has been bothered by continuing outbreaks of painful, vesicular lesions on the skin of her right chest for the past year. She is treated with unrecalled medication and the skin lesions resolved, but the pain persists for the next 3 months. Which of the following is the most likely cause for her findings?

A 6 yr old boy complains of discomfort in the right upper neck that has worsened over the past 6 months. On PE, a 5-cm, firm mass is palpable in the right lateral neck. The mass is not painful or warm. On biopsy, tumor cells were described as round and spindled cells in myxoid stroma. Occasional cross-striations in the cytoplasm was observed. Which of the following immunohistochemical stain is most likely to be positive in these cells?
A 28 yr old female complains of a 5.0cm, painful, abdominal mass. Pertinent past medical history shows a previous caesarean section. An

A 37-year-old woman has noticed increasing deformity and difficulty with movement involving her left hand over the past 6 months. On PE, there is a contracture involving the third digit of her left hand that prevents her from fully extending this finger. A firm, hard, cordlike, 1 x 3 cm area is palpable beneath the skin of the left palm. Microscopically, which of the following is most likely to be seen in greatest abundance composing this lesion?

A biopsy was done and microscopic examination shows abundant basophilic extracellular matrix, arborizing capillaries, and primitive cells at various stages of adipocyte differentiation resembling fetal fat. If cytogenetic testing was done, what is the most likely finding?

A 32 year old man comes to the physician because he has noticed a lump over his right flank. The lump is painless and has enlarged only slowly over the past 3 years. On P.E., a soft 3-cm nodule is palpable in the subcutis of the right flank above the iliac crest. The lesion is excised. Grossly, it is circumscribed and has a uniformly yellow cut

choices.a: This mass is benign and will not recur
choices.b: More lesions will develop over time
choices.c: Metastases to regional lymph nodes are likely

question: A female medical student has had decreased vision on the left for 6 months. On physical examination. there is papilledema on the right. She has 14 scattered, 2-to-5 cm flat, hyperpigmented skin lesions with irregular borders on the extremities and torso. CT scan of the head shows a mass in the region of the right optic nerve. An optic nerve glioma is excised. Eight months later, she returns for a follow-up examination, and a mass is palpated on the right wrist. Histologic examination of the mass is most likely to show which of the following neoplasms?
Which among the statements best describe meningioma?

choices.a: Radiation to the head and neck is a risk factor

question: A 40 yr old man has been experiencing headaches for the past 6 months. He sought consult because of a seizure that occurred a day ago. There are no remarkable findings on PE. MRI of the brain shows a solitary, circumscribed 3-cm mass in the right parietal area and hemorrhage. Surgery was done and it revealed microscopically that the mass consists of sheets of cells with round nuclei that have granular chromatin. The cells have a moderate amount of clear cytoplasm. The patient receives adjuvant radiation and

A 56 yr old man sees his physician after a single episode of seizure. On PE, he is afebrile and normotensive. Motor strength is intact, and there is no loss of sensation. His mental function is not diminished. Brain MRI shows three solid, 1- to 3-cm mass lesions, without ring enhancement or surrounding edema, located at the gray-white junction in the right and left frontal lobes. The cerebral ventricles appear normal in size. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 10 yr old boy has had persistent headaches and ataxic gait for the past 3 months. CT scan of the head shows a 4-cm cystic mass in the right cerebellar hemisphere. Surgery is performed, and the mass is removed and analyzed. The prognosis given to the family was very good since the tumor was completely excised and given a Grade I classification. What was

choices.a: fine, astrocytic processes that create a fibrillary background appearance with cells showing variable degrees of nuclear pleomorphism
choices.b: disorganized arrangement and distribution of cytologically normal neurons and glia
choices.c: uniform round cells with a variably dense fibrillary background and rosette
choices.d: fibrillary areas with Rosenthal fibers and eosinophilic bodies

question: A 39-year old woman has had a worsening headache for the past week. A CT scan reveals a solitary 3 cm diameter mass lesion located in the right parietal lobe with areas of calcification. A biopsy is performed and it shows monomorphic cells with a "fried egg" appearance and "chicken wire" capillary pattern. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

choices.a: Pilocytic astrocytes with Rosenthal fibers and eosinophilic granules
choices.b: Monomorphic round cells with perivascular pseudorosettes and true rosettes

She comes to the physician because she has been unable to walk without assistance for the past week. MRI of the spine shows a 1x4 cm lesion in the filum terminale. The mass is removed. After 24 hours, due to a concomitant massive internal bleeding, the patient

choices.c: AV Malformation involving middle cerebral artery

question: A 30 yr old woman presents because of a 1-week history of mild tremor in her arm and impaired balance when walking. Symptoms disappear the following week. choices.a: 45 yr old AIDS patient with history of latent JC Virus infection
choices.b: 70 yr old on prolonged fasting, becomes quadriplegic 2-6 days after rapid correction of hyponatremia

question: Which of the following is TRUE of the pathogenesis of acne vulgaris?
